Timnas U-16: Keluarga Alfin Lestaluhu Dapat Santunan
01 Nov 2019, 07:45 by Antara, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Keluarga Alfin Lestaluhu mendapat santunan dari sebuah organisasi kemanusiaan, Aksi Cepat Tanggap (ACT). Direktur Komunikasi ACT, Lukman Azis Kurniawan, menyatakan berduka atas meninggalkan pemain Timnas U-16 ini.
Lukman menyebut pemberian santunan merupakan bentuk apresiasi ACT terhadap prestasi Alfin di bidang sepak bola. Menurut dia, bek kanan Timnas U-16 ini ikut mengharumkan Indonesia di kancah internasional.
"Kami selama ini sudah sering memberikan apresiasi kepada para pahlawan olahraga seperti Alfin, termasuk juga bagi yang sudah pensiun. Penyerahan santunan diupayakan hari ini," kata Lukman, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Ia mengatakan santunan yang diberikan berupa uang tunai senilai Rp 100 juta. Santunan tersebut akan diserahkan langsung oleh tim ACT di Ambon kepada keluarga Alfin Farhan Lestaluhu di Desa Tulehu, Kecamatan Salahutu (Pulau Ambon), Kabupaten Maluku Tengah.
Lukman berharap santunan yang akan diberikan oleh ACT dapat membantu keluarga mantan bek kanan Timnas U-16 itu, sehingga ke depannya mereka bisa terus melanjutkan hidup sepeninggal Alfin.
"Kami salut atas prestasi yang telah dicapai oleh almarhum. Semoga santunan yang diberikan bisa membantu keluarga sepeninggal almarhum. Setidaknya bisa mengurangi beban kesedihan," katanya.
Alfin Farhan Lestaluhu diketahui meninggal dunia di Jakarta karena encephalitis atau radang otak pada 31 Oktober 2019. Hari ini ia dimakamkan oleh keluarga di kampung halamannya di Desa Tulehu.
Sebelum menjalani perawatan intensif di RS Harapan Jakarta, Alfin diketahui sempat dirawat selama beberapa hari di RSUD dr. Umarella Tulehu, kemudian ditangani selama sepekan di RST Tk. II Prof dr JA Latumeten Ambon.

U-16 national team: Alfin Lestaluhu family gets compensation
01 Nov 2019, 07:45 by Antara, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Alfin Lestaluhu's family received compensation from a humanitarian organization, Aksi Cepat Tanggap (ACT). ACT's Director of Communication, Lukman Azis Kurniawan, expressed his grief over leaving the U-16 national team players.
Lukman said that giving compensation was a form of ACT's appreciation for Alfin's achievements in football. According to him, the U-16 national team right-back is helping to bring Indonesia to international level.
"We have often given appreciation to sports heroes such as Alfin, including those who have retired. Submission of compensation is sought today," Lukman said, Friday, November 1, 2019.
He said the compensation provided was in the form of cash worth Rp 100 million. The compensation will be handed over directly by the ACT team in Ambon to Alfin Farhan Lestaluhu's family in Tulehu Village, Salahutu District (Ambon Island), Central Maluku Regency.
Lukman hopes that the compensation that will be given by ACT can help the family of the former U-16 national team right-back, so that in the future they can continue to live after Alfin's death.
"We salute the achievements that have been achieved by the deceased. Hopefully the benefits provided can help families after the deceased. At least it can reduce the burden of sadness," he said.
Alfin Farhan Lestaluhu is known to have died in Jakarta due to encephalitis or inflammation of the brain on 31 October 2019. Today he is buried by his family in his hometown in Tulehu Village.
Before undergoing intensive care at Harapan Jakarta Hospital, Alfin was known to have been treated for several days at the RSUD dr. Umarella Tulehu, then handled for a week at RST Tk. II Prof. Dr. JA Latumeten Ambon.
